stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Akafuyu
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 8 Years
[Place of Birth] Higashi
[Date of Birth] Mar 27
[Race] Ægir
[Height] 176cm
[Infection Status] 
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Excellent
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Excellent
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Normal

Akafuyu, a swordsman from Higashi, is the successor of the Nobukage-ryu Iai-suemonogiri Kenpou. Aside from her mastery of traditional swordsmanship, she also possesses excellent modern combat and tactical abilities. Given how distinctively extraordinary she is as an individual, it will take some time for her to familiarize herself with Rhodes Island's combat style.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Akafuyu shows no signs of Originium infection.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.13u/L
Operator Akafuyu rarely comes into contact with Originium.

That gal wakes up before daylight and starts training every day without exception... How can she not be in good shape? Argh, I wanna arm wrestle with her... If I get to fight her, that's even better!
—Gavial

Regular physical exams show that Akafuyu's vision is much worse than average. Further tests and examinations confirm that this is not a result of Oripathy or other diseases, and current technologies are unable to correct her vision.
Akafuyu denies her vision is impaired, and, in actuality, her performance on the battlefield is exceptional; she has shown herself to be more perceptive than your average person. Clearly, her other, heightened senses and her combat skills make up for her decreased vision.
The benefits they provide in her daily life is evidently minimal, however. If you ever find her in the hallway running into the wall head on, try not to point it out to her, lest she gets angry because of that.

Akafuyu tends to be somewhat old-school with her living habits. She wakes up as soon as the sun rises before practicing her swordsmanship, eating her meals, and heading to bed at nightfall if there is nothing else to attend to.
What is surprising is that she is not the kind of person who is completely removed from modern lifestyles. When she hangs out with her fellow Higashi operators, she would often loudly compliment Utage's trendy nails and defeat everyone else in video games, especially action games.
'You think I'm the kind of girl who does nothing but battle? Besides ale and grub, we, too, like to hang out and game after training! Action games improve your ability to react as a commander. Don't you know that? What? How do I play games when I can barely see? What is that supposed to mean? I can see fine! And haven't you heard the best action games are all rhythm games?'
It seems that, with the right amount of mass appeal, no barriers can stop popular cultural works proliferating, no matter where.

Akafuyu has never attempted to hide her upbringing.
'Yeah, I'm that asshole's bastard child, and what about it? He's never admitted it anywhere. My name's been Akafuyu since I was five. Whatever my surname is, it hasn't a thing to do with him one bit.'
She was born into one of Higashi's eight distinguished families. As the illegitimate child of a noble, she was entrusted to and raised in a shrine. She was considered to be a stubborn, unruly child as she rarely obeyed any instructions. As such, she was often punished. When she was five, she met an elder from her family and was subsequently taken in by her. Under her care, she began to receive training in swordsmanship and military tactics, slowly becoming a formidable military leader. For all this time, she has never forgotten who her blood father was, but there was only ever one family member whom she trusted and one master whom she followed.
Out of consideration that Akafuyu is unwilling to have anything more to do with her blood father, his surname will remain redacted in this record.

[Classified Log]
Akafuyu is not just a swordsman; she is also a general of the military.
When the Bloodpeak Campaign came to a conclusion, Higashi found itself in another civil conflict. During the conflict, there was a general in service of the Mitsumoto faction of the Southern Court who, unhappy with her brother, the family head, stirring up a new civil conflict, chose to defect to the north and thus helping bring this conflict to a fast conclusion. Though there was a truce, it did not mean there was an everlasting peace. In the twenty years since, the two courts found themselves in frequent clashes, and the flames of war raged incessantly. In particular, the defected general was the target of multiple assassination attempts by the south. This general is Akafuyu's aunt and also the master she serves.
For years, Akafuyu led a squadron that has braved through hell and high water on the battlefield until she had a close brush with death when she found herself fallen into the enemy's trap. Although she emerged unscathed, as the commander, she was exiled by the Northern Court for the failure. She left Higashi behind and eventually found her way to Rhodes Island.
Despite being exiled by the only master she has ever trusted, Akafuyu had no complaints about the punishment she received. She still firmly believes that she will one day return to Higashi to show her master how far she has come and to fight and bring an end to the war for her master's ideals.
What Akafuyu doesn't know, however, is that, contrary to her belief, it was no mere coincidence that she received an invitation to Rhodes Island. As per the client's request, this record shall remain hidden from the operator's eyes.

Additional remark: Owing to the above, direct, one-on-one contact between Akafuyu and operator Shirayuki should be kept to a minimum.

'She is smart and hard-working.
I looked after her for all these years not because I wanted her to do battle for me or take my place as my successor.
I wanted her to not be tied down by the flames of war before her. I wish for her to find her own meaning of battle. I hope she will come to understand that we will one day face even greater perils.
I ask of you, please help her. I know you can do it.'

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

<color name=#ffffff>EPOQUE Collection New Arrivals/Temperament. Adroit tailoring and a rich modern sense for color, contrasted with accessories detailed with classical appeal. Spectacles are custom-made as a gift by the brand, for the client.</color>

skills.desc: Cannot block enemies, ATK <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</>, and attacks turn into double strikes
Immediately loses <@ba.vdown>{hp_ratio:0%}</> current HP and gain 1 <$ba.shield>Shield</> (disappears when the skill ends), ATK <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</>, DEF <@ba.vup>+{def:0%}</>

modules.desc:
Operator Akafuyu has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for solo confrontation with the enemy while far removed from support lines.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Guard Operator during field operations to exercise Musha responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

Kirara glances at Akafuyu sitting in front of the TV.
'Why are you suddenly so interested in this thing? You've been stealing looks at it.' Akafuyu doesn't turn around, but simply removes a shoulder guard with one hand and tosses it to Kirara. Her eyesight may be poor, but she's so aware of her surroundings, she might as well have a camera in her back.
'This armor...'
'It's an heirloom. It's not valuable. My master doesn't go out to fight much, so it was bequeathed to me.'
'Um, the design...'
'It's a very special shape to the armor. In the old days, each family had its own style.'
Kirara touches the shoulder guard and compares it to the armor in her game. She starts to think the developers must know of Akafuyu.
'Someone asked me almost the same question before, a little girl about your age. She would ask me under her breath, 'Captain, is your armor made of some high-tech material? Can it really withstand a grenade blast?' Ha, she might have thought I was some antique.'
'So, can it?'
'Don't be a fool. It's hard, sure, but it's just a piece of metal. You'd do better training hard and listening to your commander. She knew that, of course. Still, this armor has saved me plenty of times. Look, the pit that jumps right out at you there, that crossbow bolt almost pierced clean through my arm. Oh, and she was there in the last battle, standing next to me. Damned near died.'
Kirara suddenly loses interest in the topic.
The heavy feeling on her knees reminds her that this shoulder guard is supposed to be unique, representing an era of glory passed from one generation to the next, still thick with the stench of war and sacrifice.
But now, it's a rare item in a popular game, and any player can get it, if they pay enough.
Akafuyu stands up. Kirara decides to hurry over and take out the freshly purchased game disc before Akafuyu notices.
'By the way, do you have a minute?' Akafuyu walks towards her, 'I just killed the final boss without taking any damage. Can you upload the recording to that forum you like? Oh, and put my name on it, so you-know-who doesn't miss it...'
Kirara only now notices the game on the screen. The main character is holding a wooden sword with the lowest ATK, wearing almost no armor, except... the piece currently resting on her knees.
'Does it... bother you?'
'What? Oh, that it's my armor? If someday the people of Higashi know it from a game, rather then from a battlefield... then it can only mean that the war is finally over.' Akafuyu takes back the shoulder guard and slots it neatly into place, 'I've waited too long for that day.'

voice_lines.voiceText: What did you need me here for? Hah, that's a huge pile of papers on the desk. Filled to the brim with words, too. Just the sight of them makes me want to cut them in half!

Hfph—haah! Leave me alone. I'm trying to feel what my new technique is. Aren't techniques meant to be conceived instead of felt, you say? Hmph, I don't need to think. I just need to quiet down and feel it in my heart, and my technique will naturally unfold on my blade when the time comes.

That ninja... She may be able to stay out of your sight, but she cannot fool my senses. I know not what she's scheming, but I can promise you I shall not engage her right here and now. That said, if I find her trying to do harm to my master—You won't be able to stop my blade.

Who says I cannot see? Hmph, this medical report is full of shit. If you don't believe me, just try taking me on. Bring as many men as you want, and bring your strongest, swiftest men. Attack me from whichever direction you wish. If you make it anywhere close to my body, I'll accept defeat.

It hurts my head when I have to listen to those righteous men and their principles, especially the ones that go on and on like they are preaching their scriptures. It doesn't matter what a feast for the ears their words are. They won't hesitate to stab even their family in the back if it benefits them. How is there any righteousness in what they say? They are hypocrites, and my blade will slice them apart!

I've seen winters like that many times. The snow fell on the ground and turned red in an instant. They were everywhere, either lying prone or still sitting. I could not make out their faces, nor did I want to figure it out. My face and my chest were frozen cold, though my hands, with my blade held tight, felt hotter than ever. Tsk, why am I even telling you all this? You needn't listen, either.

Hm? How many times have I told you? Don't stand in front of me without a word! What? You wanted to make yourself more clearly seen? You're a strange fellow. I don't need to look at you to tell you apart from others! You think I just let anybody come this close to me?
{@nickname}, you look just like my master when you have such a serious look on you. I suppose... it's because both you and her are forced to go forward in chase of a grand, ambitious goal.

My master had me come to Rhodes Island for some peace and quiet, but there is no peace to be had as long as the flames of war rage in my homeland. Nonetheless, as a commander, you have my respect. {@nickname}, I am under your command. Together, we will take to the battlefield, and I shall slay everyone that stands in our way as your blade!
The air here is nice and cool. Move over a little. Let me lay down a little too.
Akafuyu, a swordsman, and the strongest you'll find. Taking a fancy to my katana? I will never set my katana down wheresoever I go. Haha, you better keep your distance if you are scared.
Hey, I'm as strong as it gets already. Stop wasting my time!
I don't need anyone's acknowledgement, but I appreciate your kindness. I will work to repay the favor.
Heh... if these guys are still here, they should be dragging me into their celebrations any minute now. How about this, {@nickname}, come with me! We'll drink till we drop tonight!
Let's get going already. My katana is starting to rust.
Now we're talking! All of you, come with me!
Now! Sortie!
No matter who, I shall slay them by my katana!
I'm here.
I've been waiting to draw my katana.
Let's take to the field!
Try taking on my blade head on!
Just watch... Here I go!
It doesn't matter whether there's one or a thousand of you! I shall slay all that come my way!
I'll slay even your will to fight back!
My katana knows exactly where my foes are.
Where are the foes actually worth fighting?
That was hardly a battle. I didn't so much as break a sweat.
We had enemies slip past us? Impossible. There's no way I didn't see them.
I won't run away. As long as my katana is in one piece, I can still fight!
What a small room! Don't keep me waiting in here for too long! I might not be able to keep myself from drawing my katana!
Hmph... Hey, if you were my enemy, I would already have cut you into two halves.
Now, now! Let's get ourselves all the ale and meat!
Arknights.

Happy New Year, and why so late to rise? I'm already back from my training. Let me tell you, think of a wish. On the first day of the new year, make 1,000 sword swings. Then that wish will come true. Do not ask whether it's true! It's real, as long as you believe it.
Hey, Doctor, how about some sword training together?

Oh? Today's your birthday, {@nickname}? Haha! Come, I'll take you for ale and meat! Honestly, why stay quiet about a day so important? Hm? you wonder what I would've gotten you if I knew? Well, need you ask? Better ale and even more meat!

Never have I asked you what we fight for, yes? Stop, no need for an answer. Words are the least reliable of all. I only care that you've considered the question, and considered it well. Lead us forth on a just path, Doctor, and I assure you my katana will be sharp enough to cut through all.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to be the Trainer in the Training Room, <@cc.kw>Guard</> Operators' Specialization training speed <@cc.vup>+30%</>

When this Operator is assigned to be the Trainer in the Training Room, <@cc.kw>Guard</> Operators' Specialization training speed <@cc.vup>+30%</>; if training this skill to Specialization Level <@cc.vup>1</>, training speed will be further increased by <@cc.vup>+45%</>
